result.execSummary:
The defendant Rick A Lincoln was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rick A Lincoln is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rick A Lincoln was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rick A Lincoln appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Thomas H Frost appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer in court for Defendant Rick A Lincoln.   Court calls case and appearances.  Also has 14 CM 261.
Court speaks to the parties.  Atty Moldenhauer speaks to the court. 
Court questions Mr. Lincoln re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds that Mr. Lincoln freely and knowingly waives his rights.  Court finds there is a factual basis.


14 CM 261-Def. pleas no contest, Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 
3 years probabtion.  Concurrent in both cases and on all counts.   + costs   Any and all other conditions the DOC imposes. 


15 CF 01 -Def pleas no contest. Court accepts plea in both counts and finds the def. guilty.  
Count 1- Dismissed
Count 2-45 Days jail. Concurrent w/ Current jail time.  + costs and DNA Surcharge. 
Count 3-

Warrants are quashed. 

SEND JOC to Arizona prison System.
Status hrg or plea at 09-30-2015 03:00 pm
Status hrg or plea at 09-09-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant, Rick A Lincoln appears by phone from Arizona Prison System. 
2:33 p.m. Court recites case and app; Court questions status; Atty M - questions Rick Lincoln how long incarcerated? Mr. L - 3 years. Court - q's Mr. L; Atty M - statement; DA - Consent a plea negotiation sentencing him while in AZ; Atty M - asks 30-45 days to send paperwork; September 9, 2015 1:00 p.m.; Mr. L can appear by video or telephone; Adj'd 2:40 p.m.
Hearing at 06-26-2015 02:30 pm
Status conference at 05-06-2015 08:15 am

Mr. Lincoln appeared late via phone, atty Moldenhauer appears in person.  State appears by Atty Frost.  Court calls case also calls 14 CM 261.  Court questions defendant as to where abouts.  Defendant states he is in AZ.  Court makes stmt further addressed the defendant warrants have been authorized.  State makes stmt requests warrant still be issued.  Atty Moldenhauer requests warrant not be issued.  State makes stmt.  Court warrants are ordered
Body Only

Attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer in court.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CM 261.  Court addressed Atty Moldenhauer.  Atty Moldenhauer addressed the Court.  Court:  Warrant ordered.  if defendant does not appear in 30 days bail is forfeited

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Rick A Lincoln appeared with Attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances. Also has 14 CM 261.  Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  Substitution is filed. Bail will continue.
Arraignment at 02-09-2015 11:00 am

Defendant, Rick A Lincoln appeared with Attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Also has 14CM261.  State calls Officer Trevor Peterson to the stand.  Clerk swears in Officer Peterson.  State questions Officer Peterson.  Court finds that the Officer has identified the defendant.  No further questions from the state. Cross examination by Atty Moldenhauer. State Obj's. Atty Moldenhauer continues questioning.  Court speaks to Atty Moldenhauer.  No further questions. Witness is excused.  Argument.  Court finds there is probable cause and that the defendant committed a felony in Washburn County and is bound over for trial.  State offers information. Bail will continue.  Arraignment scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 27, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Rick A Lincoln not in court.  Angeline E. Winton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Trevor Peterson present in court.
9:11 am Court recites case & nonappearance of deft - status conf. today; recessed until deft arrives.  Adj'd 9:12 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rick A Lincoln in court with attorney Joseph H. Loso.  Defendant Rick A Lincoln in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances. Also has 14cM261. Atty Loso can not represent Mr. Lincoln in the felony case--but will discuss it with the public defendant's office.    Waived reading.  Not guilty plea is entered.  Court addresses bail.   Atty Loso speaks to the court.  
Bail modification is denied today. If the def. can prove that he is purchasing a house in the area and has employment. Court will discuss bail.   Atty Loso speaks to the court regarding furlo for 72 hrs.  State speaks to the court and asks for the request to be denied.  The Def. speaks to the court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
